title: Re: cool
content:
I'm pretty sure the GBA plays GBC games.
If not... stooopid!

Anyway, I don't even see the GBC game as a real Keen game, so I won't be buying it, or a GB of any kind.
I'd rather spend my money elsewhere, and usually that is PC-stuff instead.
(Most excited about Supreme Commander at the moment.)

Then again I have been thinking about getting myself something smallish to play games with when I'm waiting for something, which happens.
If I do, I'd rather get something newer like a Nintendo DS, although I think I'd be more compatible with a Sony PSP instead.
For now I'll stick with PC.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: cool
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]cool! now to find a place where they sell Gameboy colors[hr][/quote]

Why would you want one? Buy an GBA or DS instead, you can play a lot more classics on these consols and they can handle GBC games like Keen too.

Anyway, I'm really annoyed by this advertisement. When I first saw it I sprinted immediately to the shop only to find out that they didn't have the game.

Bah.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-annoyed.gif[/img]:"> -----------------

title: Re: cool
content: Actually GBC games aren't compatible with the Nintendo DS (it is GBA compatible though). If I could find a Gameboy Color and Commander Keen game really cheap i'd probably buy it, you know, as a collector's item. The last time I saw a Gameboy Color, it was only $40 (bargain) but that was like 4 years ago. Wish i'd bought it. But I was just a stupid little kid then and I had nearly no money.
